intro: Pinalia djaratensis, commonly known as the Djaratensis pinalia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
